title: Ashes place in the PROJECT universe

I'll buy that skin for the dance music alone! _Please remove any afk warnings while listening to it..._

I did some Fraps ingame recording of it, and stuck it on repeat for 37 minutes afterwards. Was truly, truly, truly outrageous with my 15" subwoofer. :D

If I *****cough***** _we_ can have more of it, that'd be beyond great!

_You, ehm, wouldn't happen to know the exact location and filename of that music, so I can extract it from the client?_ ;)

Okay, so I asked Riot Sound Bear (Brandon, who did the sfx for Ashe) about it and he said it's a remix of an upcoming piece of music. He's also really flattered and seriously considering making a full track >xD

>Okay, so I asked Riot Sound Bear (Brandon, who did the sfx for Ashe) about it and he said it's a remix of an upcoming piece of music. He's also really flattered and seriously considering making a full track >xD

Tell him to pitch in himself, so we can thank him directly - and stuff him full of cookies, all while also persuade him to make said track. :D 

{{item:2054}} {{item:2054}} {{item:2054}} {{item:2054}} {{item:2054}} {{item:2054}} {{item:2052}} 

http://orig04.deviantart.net/cfa4/f/2014/276/d/6/dancing_poro_for_instalok__by_xxthebluetigerxx-d81htr3.gif

_Now 21 minutes has passed, and I'm still having (again) the Ashe-dance trax on in the background..._

But so as to not forget about the rest of the skin, what was the thought behind the "Avarosa"-companion? Was it always planned to be just a generic computer voice, or did you take influence from GLaDOS?

Because I did immediately think of GLaDOS - and so, by default, this song:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y6ljFaKRTrI

...when I first heard "Avarosa" speak.
Let me just make it clear that's not a bad thing! ^^

Hello! 
So Chemicalseb (on of our amazing composers) and I found some really cool elements in the Project Ashe login music that we felt could work.  Chemicalseb took over from that point and made some magical decisions and created a really cool beat with those elements.With the time that we had we were able to make a 3 bar loop work for Project Ashe's dance. So glad you love the loop, I am hoping we can re visit that loop and make it a song!  I am sure Chemicalseb would love to chime in on how he came up with the piece he did!

To answer the motivation behind Avarosa's VO processing, we had a rioter who wanted to play the part of the VO. The rioter was super excited and as she is not the talent we normally use for events like these I decided to use a little heavier processing than normal to help the thematic.  The processing was fairly simple but effective in masking the talent recorded. We used Cubase to modify the VO using pitch quantizing and straightening, which ended up sounding as you hear it now, minus a few other plugins! In short, GlaDos was not the intention, but kind of cool it got close!

*sigh*

I'll have to add you to my list of people with cool names.

To various degrees, we enjoy fleshing out the story of each thematic as we work on it. Sometimes it's just a few sentences that set up the world, sometimes it's quite in-depth. But for skins it's primarily to drive our design decisions. It helps to give the final package a strong thematic cohesion.

Returning to a theme, like PROJECT, is an opportunity to further explore an alternate world and push what that thematic means. I really wanted to build on what we did last year by shedding some light on the conflict in PROJECT as well as express the core theme explicitly. I also thought it would be fresh if these new champions felt like they had more specialist roles in contrast to last year's fighting force.

But Hideo Kojima is a free agent now so anything is possible >:P

Might I ask, was there a push to make 4 instead of 3, so we could have a full 5v5 with all unique PROJECT skins? We are now only missing a second dedicated support.
Top has Fiora and Yasuo
Jungle has Yi and Ekko
Mid with Zed and Katarina
Marksman has Lucian and Ashe
Support has Leona

Of course there is some flex, with Ekko and Yasuo mostly, but either way Support is lacking a second dedicated PROJECT champion.
Unless Riot is gonna break tradition and make this year's Ultimate skin go along with an existing skin line (and also giving us two supports in a row).

Was there a push to fill out a "second" PROJECT team, but just no time/resources, or was it just a set three when the team laid their plans out for things this time around?
There is also Program Soraka & Lissandra, and battlecast skins: Viktor, Cho'Gath, Urgot, Vel'Koz, Xerath, Kog'Maw, Skarner.

I like to imagine that when Ashe does her death animation and calls for a 'MEDIC!' it's Program Soraka that comes to her aid. But then she looks up and sees her healing her with nanomachines and an inhuman smile and is all like "NOOO MY HUMANITY!"
Did someone say...  http://i252.photobucket.com/albums/hh37/pleasure_roof/Nanomachines.jpg~original

Thanks, I didn't want to sleep anyway...

#nightmareFuel
Those are seperate skin lines. I am just wondering if they left it at 9 intentionally, or planned for 10 with this set and just didn't have the time or resources for the 4th this year.

There was no cancelled PROJECT skins, our target for this year was these three. I can't tell you when we do cut something because of the disappointment it would cause but I guess I can when we hit our target >:)

After how well PROJECT was received last year we knew we would be revisiting this world, and given the excitement around these new skins I think we'll be going here again in the future (although each time we try to bring something new and unexpected). We were more concerned about bringing some AP champions to project than trying to fill out an entire second team. I think once we have at least a 5 man team for a skin thematic the discussion of team comp takes a back seat to a whole bunch of other objectives.

Not super relevant, but how well was Elderwood recieved? Could we see more Elderwood champs (and maybe some brighter champs this time, instead of dark ones? :3)? I really love nature-y / life-y skins and all that, so it'd be super cool to see more of it.

You might have already guessed but the dark whimsy of an enchanted forest doesn't have the same broad reaching appeal as 'sci fi ninjas', not to say there aren't players who absolutely love it of course! Being artists, we on the skins team are also really in love with Elderwood and speaking personally it's a thematic I'll always be pushing for more of. There's nothing we are working on right now, but there are plenty more ideas!

So far we have the Watchful Eye,  the Silent Guardian and the Fae Queen who presides over all. But what of cursed creatures that lurk in damp shadows, or beneath calm pools of collected dew? What of intrepid ambitious truth-seekers, ancient truth-speakers and those grown anew?
DO I SMELL {{champion:29}}
http://www.dhresource.com/0x0s/f2-albu-g2-M00-47-27-rBVaGlUrNLeAUyP4AAXEMaI13OE643.jpg/ems-wholesale-treasure-hunt-moss-grass-animal.jpg
Is it harder to do ap PROJECT skins since they seem mostly focused on weapon based champions?

I think that was part of the reasoning. At the time we wanted to ensure the skins felt like very grounded future-tech and not 'space magic' so using AD champions with bladed weapons was a solid starting point. But after last year, seeing players excited enough about PROJECT that they were playing easily counter-able comps with no AP, we were very eager to rectify this. I think in the future it will still favour AD champs with blades or guns, but you never know!

That sounds very interesting to me.
Do you already have some plans for certain skin series?Or do you decide this stuff later on?

The arcade and boss series comes to my mind,where arcade is only missing a midlaner,while battle boss still needs top,adc and jungle(though i feel like morde is perfect for the top-position but he needs a vgu first)

Yeah some times we do. Like with Pool Party Ziggs, we made sure the next 4 filled out a team. PROJECT was a team, albeit one without magic damage. Even the RPG skins form a team when you add Rugged Garen to the top lane.

Other times we make a conscious choice to not worry about that for now and just make some smart decisions from the potential pool of champions. We would never force a skin on a champion that we don't think would be an excellent addition to a skin line.

Can we be sure about Leona though? I mean during the OVERDRIVE event she was still in the "production" (her weapons leaning against the wall, and she herself was inside one of those tanks when I recall correctly) and when she really has false memories then mabye she sees PROJECT: Unity as enemies (terrorists maybe) of the people she tries to protect.
OR HERETICS
Lol, Unity seems a little stacked considering numbers and they have every role. :)

You know, now that we know that there is a counter group (Unity), each of the roles fall in place for a movie.

**PROJECT**
In the distant future, Piltover becomes the city of dreams where the evolution of mankind is promised. However, the promise is false. PROJECT, a series of extraordinary individuals enhanced through technology, has become the top of society. Indivudals in the Project series are hardwired to follow "The Leader", an individual who plans to use PROJECT to enforce his will. However, some PROJECT members have formed a rebellion. Lead by Ashe, one of the first PROJECT members, they fight so that humanity will not fall to PROJECT and "The Leader".
Recently, the individual known as Yi has been put into PROJECT. If what they have heard is true, Yi is the next step in PROJECT. He is far beyond anything that has been put into PROJECT before. Ashe has sent members Lucian and Fiora to save Yi before he is hardwired to follow "The Leader". However, PROJECT member Zed follows them secretly, waiting for the right moment to strike.

> Indivudals in the Project series are hardwired to follow "The Leader", an individual who plans to use PROJECT to enforce his will.

Or _her_ will.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}
This explains why Fiora and Lucian picked up Yi. Ashe probably sent one if not both of them to rescue him.

One question I'm wondering about right now is what the memories are about, because from Overdrive last year it felt implied that PROJECT Yi had artificial memories implanted to make him think he was Master Yi, and PROJECT Yi was actually not Yi at all before being made a cyborg. 

I may be totally wrong about this, but I feel like the PROJECT roster isn't comprised of the actual champions, but people in a futuristic setting who've been altered and mentally reprogrammed to make them think they're the characters we know. Some power in this future setting built cyborg warriors in the image of ancient heroes and villains, and intended to use them as tools for their own ends. They intended to use some technological power to mimic the abilities of the originals, but as these PROJECT champions began to explore who their memories actually belonged to their powers grew and they developed techniques their counterparts once utilized. That last bit I thought up from the promos last year, where they detailed the origins of the champion's abilities through their tech except for their ultimates, which all had unknown origins. 

I dunno I could be totally off base, just something seems weird about the memories of these champions and the whole "Don't trust false memories" vibe from last year. It feels like the names these PROJECT people bear are of the people who they were intended to be made in to or something.

That's really interesting and fits with a lot of details.
Only problem seems to be "They cannot take our pasts from us.", but maybe that refers to their normal/real past that has been overwritten with the personality of the "old" champions.

So either the "real" champions have been upgraded and their memories have been tinkered with to create soldiers,
or normal people in that AU got upgrades and implanted memories that turn them into the champions/weapons.

I stick to 2 for the time being, since only humanoid champions with weapons have been released so far in the PROJECT line.

I really like the second idea. It would also explain why certain champions aren't full metal (Leona, Ekko, Lucian): The person captured to become Leona looked like her, so they didn't need to replace much of her body. While other champions like Fiora needed a complete face reconstruction. 

And why don't they construct complete robots and feed them with memories? Well it is said that PROJECT is, "the perfect fusion of one’s supernatural essence with advanced weaponry and body augmentation." Supernatural essence...I personally interprete that as the soul (after all magic and soul-stuff plays a role in LoL) so they need real persons which they turn into cyborgs to create perfect soldiers.
Ashe is also unity because her goal in her lore is too unite the different clans of the freljord and that is a large part of her theme.
